title: Getting rid of annoying "Support us" popup
creator: mikkel5
content:
Is there a way to hide the popup asking for support either permanently or for a longer period?

I fully get the need to ask for support, but this one pops up many times a day, which is just too much.

title: Why doesn't Thunderbird collect new addresses?
creator: mwolfe941
content:
I have looked at past comments about the lack of an address book with Thunderbird for Android and the responses are not how life works. If I had to save every contact in my Google contacts it would have tens of thousands of contacts and be unusable because it was so large.

The way life works, you mat correspond with someone you are doing business with from one or 2 times, over the couse of a month until the task is done, and maybe for the rest of your life, who you would put in your address book.

I am currently apply for a ------. I am corresponding with a group of individuals until it closes and then I will never correspond with them again.

It is a hassle to go back to the previous email to copy their email addresses. It would be nice if TB remembered that I have been corresponding with them, and auto fill their address, like the desktop version and other email apps. Likewise, I don't want to save them in permanent contacts. If I had to do that, my permanent contacts would be unmanageable.

So yes, Thunderbird needs an address book like the desktop version. This is a deal breaker. TB was excellent in synchronization with the servers but if I have to go back the previously received emails to get their addresses, I'll have to bail on TB.

Please listen, you can see I'm not the only one.

title: Thunderbird for Android
creator: mdyekman
content: Recently installed Thunderbird for Android on my Pixel 7. The migration seemed to work, however, the folders on my accounts are empty. My guess is an error in communication. The account email addresses are correct. Cannot find a setting or security setting addressing the issue. I am using OAuth2. Was never asked for a pin or password during the migration process. Just used the download on Google Play. Successfully migrated Thunderbird to my tablet. Similar issue, except after 2 days and multiple downloads it just started working. Any help would be appreciated.
